solution_line_template: He earns ${price_french_fries} + ${price_poutine} = $<<{price_french_fries}+{price_poutine}={daily_sales_income}>>{daily_sales_income} after selling the French fries and Poutine every day.
So, he earns ${daily_sales_income} x {days_per_week} = $<<{daily_sales_income}*{days_per_week}={weekly_gross_income}>>{weekly_gross_income} every week.
And the total amount he pays for the taxes is ${weekly_gross_income} x {tax_rate_decimal}= $<<{weekly_gross_income}*{tax_rate_decimal}={weekly_tax_amount}>>{weekly_tax_amount}.
So, his income after paying the weekly taxes is ${weekly_gross_income} - ${weekly_tax_amount} = $<<{weekly_gross_income}-{weekly_tax_amount}={income_after_taxes}>>{income_after_taxes}.
Lucius spends ${daily_ingredient_cost} x {days_per_week} = $<<{daily_ingredient_cost}*{days_per_week}={weekly_ingredient_cost}>>{weekly_ingredient_cost} for the ingredients every week.

Therefore, his total income every week after buying all the ingredients and paying the taxes is ${income_after_taxes} - ${weekly_ingredient_cost} = $<<{income_after_taxes}-{weekly_ingredient_cost}={total_weekly_income_after_expenses}>>{total_weekly_income_after_expenses}.
